intro: Galium mollugo var. elatum, commonly known as tall bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported diuretic properties.
